poem:
A New Rhythm

In the hum of Hackney's air,  
a new rhythm stirs—  
four beats to the week.  
Workers weave daylight  
into rest.  
Immunology echoes,  
a pint poured slow,  
and hope breathes  
in the space between  
closed doors.  
Time becomes generous—  
a gift of hours  
to cradle our days anew.
